Comment: This is a game from the first round of the 37th GK tournament.   This is, I think, a good lesson in early development.  Let me know what you think.
The Scandinavian or centre-counter attack.  I don't mind playing against this variation as white, since I think that developing the black Queen at this early stage allows white some initiative.

Defending the e7 square but...
curtains!  White threatens either Rg4 , but in any event the black queen must now move from a dark square, allowing the capture on e7 and mate.  At this point, my opponent graciously resigned.
